poem:
### Ode to the Electrified Clothes Horse

In the dim-lit room,  
coil of wires hums like a secret,  
embracing the damp sleeves,  
a modern shrine to warmth.  
Outside, raindrops gossip,  
but here, a quiet unraveling,  
a slow exhale of steam,  
eternal spring,  
each sock and shirt lifted,  
a modest resurrection,  
one cotton prayer at a time.
